definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)
to stake all on one throw
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
the person involved/the people holding power
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
